hypothesis_content.title: Negative News Amplification in Low-Liquidity Windows
hypothesis_content.statement: Negative macro catalyst news (like the current 'scarier macro catalyst') released during Asian trading hours (00:00-08:00 UTC) will produce an initial overreaction that is partially reversed (30-50% retrace) during the first 2 hours of the London/European open (08:00-10:00 UTC), as deeper liquidity meets algorithmic buying at oversold levels.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Asian hours often have thinner liquidity, amplifying news-driven moves. The London open brings institutional liquidity and algorithmic systems that fade extreme moves, especially if the news is not fundamentally new but a repackaging of existing fears. The current 'scarier macro catalyst' headline fits this pattern.
entry_conditions: Significant negative macro news headline timestamped between 00:00-08:00 UTC
BTC drops >3% within 90 minutes of the news
RSI(14) on 15m chart drops below 30 during the selloff

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 40% of the initial news-driven drop (from pre-news high to post-news low)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new low (below the initial reaction low) after 08:00 UTC
exit_conditions.time_exit: At 10:00 UTC (2 hours after London open)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The retracement fails to materialize >50% of the time, and price continues down with the London open's liquidity.
